columns.text: This task asks **to determine why companies are willing to pay the rating agency to calculate their debt.**

Bonds rating depends only on the level of riskiness how much the debt is likely to fail. The firm that has the highest rank means has the lowest risk of default. When future investors search for a company to invest in, they will choose a company with the lowest chance of not returning the money. If there is such a risk of not returning the money, the investors will require the level of riskiness. There are a lot of risk-taker investors that will invest in the company no matter the level of riskiness, but they will require a higher return.
**That is the reason why companies are doing it voluntarily. They want to have as highest bond rank possible to attract as many investors as possible and give the lowest possible rate of return.**
In the following exercise, we must explain why some companies that issue their bonds, hire agencies to rate their bonds even though it is expensive and is not required.

Now, we will start by explaining the concepts of bonds and risk rating agencies.

**A bond** is a fixed-income financial instrument in which companies or governments issue debt papers to finance themselves. This paper represents a commitment to pay the investor by the issuer corresponding to the money borrowed plus any interest rate in a period determined by the issuer.

**Risk rating agencies** are entities whose objective is to analyze, study and finally qualify the risk associated with a particular asset. For this purpose, these agencies analyze the financial statements, solvencies, and other information that allow them to know the payment capacity of a company that decides to issue a fixed or variable income instrument.

Next, we will analyze why some companies consider it relevant to have their bonds rated by risk rating agencies.

Companies consider it relevant that these agencies rate their corporate bonds since this will allow investors to mitigate their uncertainty concerning the payment capacity that the issuer of the bond has at a certain time. A high rating on a corporate bond will indicate that the probability of a non-payment by the issuer is very low. Therefore, the risk will be lower, and so will be the coupon paid by the issuer.

On the other hand, if a corporate bond is rated low, the associated risk will be higher, so investors will require more compensation to finance the company, which means a higher coupon payment.
